EmailTemplate.name: 201712_PressureRegulator_LG.201712_PressureRegulator_Email
EmailTemplate.subject: Tech Tips - Boeing 737NG Pneumatic System Troubleshooting
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
<[[https://aerospace.honeywell.com/]]>
Dear Customer, Have you experienced a bleed trip light illumination on your 737NG pneumatic system? Boeing has released a helpful video and supporting documentation.
Bleed trip light illumination can be caused by over-pressure or over-temperature conditions. An over-temperature condition is more common than an over-pressure condition. It can be difficult to tell which part might be causing the problem when so many parts can impact pressure or temperature conditions.
The pressure regulator shut-off valve (3214552-6) is often replaced when a bleed trip light is activated on the P5 panel. To help identify the correct failed component, Boeing has published a 737NG pneumatic system troubleshooting video.
Please refer to the MyBoeingFleet website <https://www.myboeingfleet.com/ReverseProxy/Authentication.html> for the latest aircraft maintenance manual and FIM for the 737NG aircraft. The "737NG Pneumatic System Troubleshooting Training Video" can be found under “Supplemental Videos”.
Need other technical support? Visit our MyAerospace Technical Knowledge Center <[[http://goaero.honeywell.com/u7Z0000I0q0G0902600QXk0]]> for troubleshooting articles, technical publications, or to submit questions to our technical support engineering team.
Visit MyAerospace <[[https://myaerospace.honeywell.com/]]> Please click here <[[http://goaero.honeywell.com/TyZQ00i0n000bIw20qiiGX0]]> to subscribe to our email communications.
